steps.title: Digitally adjusted pulse-width modulation
steps.content: Digitally adjusted pulse-width modulation In the engineering world, â€œDPWMâ€ stands for â€œDigitally adjusted pulse-width modulation,â€ which provides a digital to time domain conversion in controllers. The time is quantized into numbers of discrete slots, which is then selected by a digital input (d[n]), instead of a carrier ramp signal. [1] X Research source
